entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxDescription
entry.value: Heavy APC with dual autocannons, extra manned weapons, and communication equipment.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxFlavor
entry.value: The Taurox is a heavily armoured transport that is armed with heavy weapons. While not as flexible as a Chimera, it's more akin to a tank in terms of firepower and armour.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxAssaultDescription
entry.value: Medium APC that rapidly deploys infantry. It's armed with a pinning Gatling Cannon, but only has one manned Lasgun Array.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxAssaultFlavor
entry.value: While most Taurox patterns are essentially tougher Chimeras, some designs sacrifice this protection for aggression.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxIFVDescription
entry.value: Heavy IFV with a twin-linked autocannon, a multitude of manned weapons, and communication equipment. Has fewer cargo slots compared to a typical Taurox.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxIFVFlavor
entry.value: Typically, Tauroxes and Taurox Primes are used to breach enemy lines and gain a foothold. Tortuga Pattern Tauroxes turn that foothold into a strongpoint.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxPlasmaDescription
entry.value: Heavy IFV that rapidly deploys infantry and supports them with a plasma cannon and a multitude of manned weapons. Has fewer cargo slots compared to a typical Taurox.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TauroxPlasmaFlavor
entry.value: On the ancient Forge World of Ryza, the Adeptus Mechanicus enjoys unleashing the full might of technology upon the indigenous techno-barbarians. Famously, the produce large quantities of high-quality plasma and laser weapons. Ryzan manufactorums also natively produce vehicles armed with these weapons, such as the Leman Russ Executioner. Even among the Tempestus Scions, only the best of the best are granted access to Ryza Pattern Taurox Primes.
